intro: Centaurea minor, commonly known as lesser centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender, hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically blooms from late spring to early autumn, producing clusters of tubular florets surrounded by pale blue bracts. Native to Europe and western Asia, it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine make it a notable species in botanical studies.
